etymologies: mid 18th century: from Latin, literally ‘fine powder’

definitions: a fine powdery substance, typically yellow, consisting of microscopic grains discharged from the male part of a flower or from a male cone. Each grain contains a male gamete that can fertilize the female ovule, to which pollen is transported by the wind, insects, or other animals.
shortDefinitions: fine powdery substance consisting of microscopic grains discharged from male part of flower
